appearances.title: West Coast News Wrap : KTVU : January 9, 2026 7:30pm-8:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: congress member emily randall, sharing a similar sentiment, writing in part that kristi noem, lawlessgents are out of control and that enough is enough. referencing thursday's shooting in portland and the deadly shooting of a minneapolis woman by ice agents on wednesday. the very same day, masked agents in an unmarked car arrested three people on seattle's aurora avenue. mayor katie wilson posting a video to facebook calling the arrest an abuse of power, but also acknowledging seattle's limited authority regarding the actions of federal agencies. >> so i'm working with police chief barnes, city attorney evans. immigrant rights groups and local leaders to identify every possible legal argument, public resource, and creative tool we can use to keep the people of seattle safe. >> and that was fox thirteen's frankie thompson reporting tonight. earlier today, assistant homeland security secretary tricia mclaughlin defended the border patrol agents decision to open fire in portland. >> our law enforcement officers pulled them over as they were approaching the vehicle, when they realized whe

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 8, 2026 6:30pm-8:52pm EST
appearances.snippet: congress member luz rivas of california and emily randall of washington state for hosting us with thiscial order hour. i know, as they being two freshmen congresswomen and i know at least one other freshman congresswoman that will be joining in the discussion, just reflect the tremendous amount of talent and passion to make a difference in this freshman class, and we are so blessed to have them in the caucus, and it's so important to witness the efforts that the two congresswomen hosting us have made in regard to accessibility and affordability. it's the most appreciated. after months of pushing, democrats succeeded in forcing a vote to extend aca subsidies that offer life saving health care benefits to millions of families. that extension just passed the house just hours ago, but the fight isn't over. to secure these benefits and meaningfully lower costs for americans, the senate must act at once to restore these benefits and ease the burden of rising costs for people like mika, one of my constituents from new york's 20th congressional district, mika was born and raised in schenectady

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 7, 2026 10:00am-11:17am EST
appearances.snippet: and as i prepared to part ways with baby jay, to my new to my washington state colleague, emily randall, i wanted to share this lighthearted piece of washington delegation history in the spirit of continuity and camaraderie that it represents with the house of today. thank you, mr. speaker. >> the chair. >> thank you, mr. speaker. today i rise to celebrate the new football coach of washington state university, coach kirby moore. just before the holidays, wsu hired kirby moore, a washington native, as our new head coach. kirby moore is young, he's hungry, and he's armed with an impressive coaching resume. coach moore is ready to lead the cougs to new heights in his first head coaching role. kirby grew up going to cougar football games and said, quote, for me, this is home. we've got grandparents in the palouse, aunts in pullman and spokane, and that his parents just built a house in the tri-cities, and that these are incredible memories for his kids, the same memories that he grew up with. so as such, mr. speaker, i welcome coach kirby moore back to the palouse back home, and i look forw
